Billy Hayes.Action: Prepares to smuggle drugs on his body with intense focus and care, indicating a serious but cautious approach.
Carefully conceals hashish plaques on his body using tape, demonstrating meticulous preparation and attention to detail.
Shows nervousness and vulnerability by admitting he feels poisoned and strained.
Stops walking to confide in Susan about his physical discomfort.
Conceals 40 plaques of hashish taped to his body and attempts to pass through an airport security checkpoint.
Suddenly breaks stride and holds his belly, showing nervousness and possibly physical distress near security guards.
Responds to guards politely and tries to explain the frisbee with a playful gesture.
Exhibits visible nervousness and panic, but does not lash out or show hostility.
Curses the frisbee quietly when it becomes a problem at the security check.
Checks himself anxiously in the mirror, exhibits visible nerves, but composes himself with a deep breath and dons sunglasses to mask his anxiety before facing guards.
Responds promptly and accurately to guard's commands during security check—hands over passport, opens bag as requested.
Attempts to explain a frisbee to guards using minimal English and gestures, though this causes some tension and suspicion.
Meets the guard's gaze steadily without looking away, showing calmness and sincerity under pressure.
Takes Susan's hand in his and offers a relieved smile, showing trust and connection.
Removes sunglasses as requested without argument, cooperating with the guard's gesture.
Understands the guard's gesture to remove his glasses without verbal instruction and maintains eye contact confidently, not trying to look away.
Tenses and sweats nervously when confronted by the guard, showing internal anxiety.
Recognizes the building panic quickly when police start a security check, showing awareness of the situation.
Dismisses Susan's concerns playfully and lightly, possibly showing a lack of serious engagement momentarily.
Urgently instructs Susan to leave and get seats on the plane, showing protective behavior despite his own panic.
Panics silently and tries to hide under the seat, showing fear and vulnerability but no aggressive or cold behavior.
Freezes in panic upon realizing he may have lost his passport, but immediately tries to hide and instructs Susan urgently to secure their seats on the plane.
Tries to appear casual and cooperative when confronted by the officer during the search, spreading his arms to comply.
Deceives the officers by pretending he has already been searched to bypass the first officer.
Stands still with arms up, eyes closed, trying to remain calm during a tense search and threat of violence.
Stands still with arms raised and eyes closed, not panicking when falsely accused of carrying a bomb under high threat and intense scrutiny by armed officers and soldiers.
Allows the officers to discover the hashish hidden on his body without resistance or suspicious behavior, maintaining composure in a critical moment.
Does not attempt to flee or escalate the situation when confronted by dozens of armed soldiers alerted by a false bomb suspicion.
Manages a glance at Susan with a strong movement signaling 'No, don't come down the stairs' to protect her
Watches bewildered as guards violently rummage through his luggage, including personal and sentimental items
Makes a strong, clear nonverbal signal ('No. Don't come down the stairs') to Susan despite being roughly led by soldiers.
Remains scared, sweating, and bewildered while being searched and having his belongings torn apart, showing less control and composure in chaotic situation.
Responds clearly and cooperatively to police questioning despite confusion and language barriers.
Appears bewildered and passive during police processing, showing limited proactive agency.
Grins at the camera to comply with officers' expectations despite the situation.
Endures physical pain and humiliation without retaliation to maintain appearance as directed.
Initially smiles at the camera as instructed but quickly adjusts his expression to look miserable after being corrected.
Appears confused and puzzled about the officers' intentions and the situation.
Complies with officers' demands and physically endures pain without resistance.
Submissively lifts arm for permission to speak, indicating cautiousness but also lack of control over situation.
Slowly and skillfully removes two plaques of hashish hidden in his boots, revealing hidden contraband.
Tries to explain his mistake awkwardly and ineffectively, showing poor communication skills.
Feels enormously humiliated but remains quiet and compliant in front of officers and soldiers leering at him.
Reaches quietly for his clothes when fellow American Tex offers them, showing gratitude.
Responds softly and hopefully to detective's question, showing sincerity and trust.
Quietly reaches for his clothes without losing focus on Tex, showing composure under humiliation.
Softly replies 'No, I'm not afraid' though internally feels afraid, indicating an attempt to project confidence despite vulnerability.
Hoping and uncertain in response to the detective's proposal, showing some lack of assertiveness.
Answers questions honestly and acknowledges he would recognize the cabdriver again.
Agrees to cooperate by pointing out the cabdriver to authorities.
Admits to not being a smuggler and that it was his first time carrying hashish.
Says he just needed extra money and was broke, showing vulnerability and honesty.
Is able to recall and identify the cabdriver who sold him hashish and agrees to cooperate by potentially pointing him out again.
Shows awareness of the political danger regarding flying during a period of attacks and drug crackdown but shrugs off the risks as 'stupid.'
Admits he was carrying hashish for extra money and that it was his first time smuggling, indicating lack of experience and poor judgment.

Does not boast or act defensive despite difficult situation; responds calmly and sincerely.
Mentions family and girlfriend matter-of-factly, showing emotional connection.

Shows naivete about drug dealing and the consequences of his actions.
Sits alone, nervous, trying to figure out a difficult situation quietly without bothering others.
Sits nervously alone in a crowded foreign cafe, carefully observing people and scanning the environment to find the seller, indicating awareness and caution.
His eyes rove anxiously among suspicious-looking men watching him, showing tension and nervousness but also vigilance, implying a moderate level of situational awareness.
Recognizes the importance of choosing the right moment and carefully selects one of the cabdrivers after assessing several, signaling that he takes calculated risks and shows strategic thinking.
Tentatively rises as if to join the plainclothesmen but instead moves slyly towards the interior of the cafe and eventually escapes through the back door.
Looks back with a sense of betrayal in his eyes when Tex threatens to shoot him despite calling him 'a nice enough kid'.

Eases out the back door with a backward glance, showing calculated caution and awareness of surroundings.
Freezes instantly when a gun is pointed at him, showing prudent caution and presence of mind rather than panic.
Tentatively rises as if to join the plainclothesmen but does not follow them, indicating hesitation.

Hugging himself for warmth and initially repulsed and confused, showing a lack of situational awareness early on.
